[Student]: open when they entered the kitchen where Mrs Carew lived so long after she had left her husband and son buried beneath some tree tops
[Teacher]: at the bottom of a frozen lake in a place called. Mrs Carew was a bit of a recluse, and her daughter was in her late teens, so they didn't often have dinner together, and it was clear that the young woman was
[Student]: in no hurry at all to leave this lonely spot without supper while she ate alone during such hardships as the other two girls were having
[Teacher]: at school the winter before last. The girl who was the older sister had been the one to do most of the cooking. She had always loved her cooking and was in her element in the kitchen, whipping up dishes that were both delicious and comforting.
